newsitem.title: JAPAN: Matsushita Elec to sell set-top boxes for JSkyB.
newsitem.headline: Matsushita Elec to sell set-top boxes for JSkyB.

text.p: Japanese consumer electronics giant Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it plans to sell antennas and set-top boxes for the Japanese satellite broadcasting venture JSkyB.

"We are already selling antennas and set-top boxes for PerfecTV and are planning to sell those for DirecTV. We're also planning to do the same for JSkyB," a Matsushita official said, without giving further details.

Japan Sky Broadcasting Corp (JSkyB), led by media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp, Japan's Softbank Corp, Sony Corp and Fuji Television Network, is due to start a 100-channel service next spring. Matsushita has no stake in the venture.
JSkyB will be the last of a series of operators to begin satellite broadcasting in Japan, after PerfecTV and Hughes Electronics Corp group's DirecTV.

PerfecTV, owned by a consortium of Japanese trading companies, began services last year and plans to boost its number of channels to 110 this spring. DirecTV will start offering 100 channels this autumn.

Meanwhile, Matsushita's biggest rival, Sony, told Reuters in Tokyo on Tuesday that it has not decided whether to sell antennas or set-top boxes for the JSkyB venture. A Sony spokeswoman told Reuters that the company currently sells set-top boxes only for PerfecTV in Japan.
Sony, with its strong connections to Hughes of the United States, has already sold millions of set-top boxes to American DirecTV satellite broadcasters in the United States.
